body_content.explanation: to remain at the surface of water rather than going under the water:
examples: He managed to stay afloat by holding on to the side of the boat.
The ships have to empty their ballast tanks to stay afloat.

body_content.explanation: to have enough money to pay what you owe:
examples: Many small businesses are struggling to stay afloat.
What more can I possibly do to stay afloat financially?

body_content.explanation: to remain successful or keep doing well:
examples: If you have a pupil who is struggling, it's important to intervene early to help them stay afloat academically.
The team has stayed afloat, despite injuries.
